chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Eugene Landon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: and bail bond hearing. Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Cts 1 and 2. State will move to dismiss Ct 3. State will recommend $250 fine plus costs for Ct 1 and 10 days jail and costs for Ct 2. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1 and 2. Ct 3 dismissed on State's motion. State heard. Attorney Richards heard, Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders: Ct 1- costs and to submit a DNA sample and Ct 2- 10 days jail to be time served. Court denies bond modification request.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Status continued with 22CF175 and 22CF113.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker and Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Riniker requests $1000 cash bond, each case, totaling $3000. Attorney Richards heard. Court orders $1000 cash bond, each case. Status conference set.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon not in court.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Nicholas Eugene Landon. Warrant authorized on State's motion.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon. Eric Ellis sworn and testifies. Court takes judicial notice of Crawford County Case 21CF77 and Lafayette County Case 21CF72. Exhibit #1 Report offered and received. Comments heard. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant does qualify for SPD but SPD was not able to have anyone appear for court today. Preliminary date set.
Status conference on March 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

DA Lisa Riniker appears for prosecution. Defendant appears by zoom. Court explains charges, penalties & right to counsel. Defendant heard on not appearing in person; thought court was held by zoom. Defendant to contact public defender office today. State recommends signature bond. Court sets $1000 sign bond with condition of contacting public defender office today. Status conference set for 3/21/22 at 11:00 as to counsel. Defendant to come in to sign bond on 3/15/22.
Defendant shall go to the Public Defender's Office today.
